H0.text: what are the active materials of a lead acid battery. Manganese

H1.text: what are the active materials of a lead acid battery. Copper

H2.text: what are the active materials of a lead acid battery. Zinc

H3.text: what are the active materials of a lead acid battery. Lead

A4.text: Lead and lead dioxide, the active materials on the battery's plates, react with sulfuric acid in the electrolyte to form lead sulfate.

A5.text: In the discharged state, both the positive and negative plates become lead(II) sulfate (PbSO4), and the electrolyte loses much of its dissolved sulfuric acid and becomes primarily water.
